item.title: Cache coherence protocol analysis
item.description: Write-invalidate and Write-update There are two basic cache coherence ideas. write-invalidate: when writing data, set this Cache Line in other Cache to Invalid write-update: when writing data, write the new result to other Cache that has this Cache Line Write-once protocol The write-once protocol defines four states. Invalid: indicates that the block is not legal Valid: indicates that the block is legal and may be shared, and that the data has not been modified Reserved: indicates that the block is legal, not shared, and that the data has not been changed Dirty: means the block is legal, not shared, and the data has been modified, which is different from the memory.
